subject: RE: [junit] setUp versus constructors
msgSnippet: The fact that setup() and the constructor are equivalent as Cedric pointed out is always confusing and something everyone should be aware of using JUnit.
messageBody:
The fact that setup() and the constructor are equivalent as Cedric pointed out is always confusing and something everyone should be aware of using JUnit.



Andreas



________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Cédric Beust ?
Sent: Tuesday, July 18, 2006 6:52 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] setUp versus constructors



On 7/17/06, Brett L. Schuchert <schuchert@... <mailto:schuchert%40yahoo.com> > wrote:
>
> Test Isolation
> a
> The constructor is run once, setUp (or @Before) is run before each test
> method. If you want to make sure each test has the same setup/configuration
> before the test executes, put it in setUp. If, on the other hand, you want
> to make sure all tests in a test case use the same values, put it in the
> constructor.

Not exactly: since JUnit creates a brand new instance of your test class
before every test method, putting code in your constructor is exactly
equivalent to putting it in setUp().
